alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Tolland (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 3:49PM EST until February 19 at 4:15PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Tolland County in northern Connecticut... Hartford County in northern Connecticut... * Until 415 PM EST. * At 348 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Windsor Locks, or near Enfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Interstates 84 and 91 in Connecticut. Locations impacted include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill and Avon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
